repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
**Problem**:

The current implementation of inlay hints contradicts our dev guidelines.
https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/a41546d4ac60cecc48b83f85ea9d53ee2fb7dfbb/runtime/doc/develop.txt#L313-L317

**Solution**:

Implement globally enabling inlay hints.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
• `vim.lsp.inlay_hint.enable()` can now take effect on all buffers.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -151,6 +151,8 @@ BREAKING CHANGES IN HEAD                                    *news-breaking-dev*
 The following breaking changes were made during the development cycle to
 unreleased features on Nvim HEAD.
 
+• `vim.lsp.inlay_hint.enable()` now can take effect on all buffers.

comment_data.body: Is the scope always the buffer?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,13 +4,32 @@ local ms = require('vim.lsp.protocol').Methods
 local api = vim.api
 local M = {}
 
----@class (private) vim.lsp.inlay_hint.bufstate
+---@class (private) vim.lsp.inlay_hint.globalstate Global state for inlay hints
+---@field enabled boolean Whether inlay hints are enabled for this scope

comment_data.body: Why did you remove the `not bufstate` condition here?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -34,7 +53,7 @@ function M.on_inlayhint(err, result, ctx, _)
     return
   end
   local bufstate = bufstates[bufnr]
-  if not bufstate or not bufstate.enabled then
+  if not bufstate.enabled then

comment_data.body: Again: Why not check that `bufstate` isn't nil first?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -154,7 +169,7 @@ function M.get(filter)
   end
 
   local bufstate = bufstates[bufnr]
-  if not (bufstate and bufstate.client_hints) then
+  if not bufstate.client_hints then

comment_data.body: We're not allowing `bufnr` to be nil anymore though right?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -206,9 +221,6 @@ local function clear(bufnr)
   if bufnr == nil or bufnr == 0 then

comment_data.body: Thanks, just forgot to remove the judgment here
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -206,9 +221,6 @@ local function clear(bufnr)
   if bufnr == nil or bufnr == 0 then

comment_data.body: Because I changed `bufstates` to a `vim.defaulttable`, which makes every time the indexed `bufstates[bufnr]` does not exist, it will create a new `bufstate` according to the factory method, which makes `bufstates[bufnr] ~= nil` will no longer make sense because it will always be `true`.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -34,7 +53,7 @@ function M.on_inlayhint(err, result, ctx, _)
     return
   end
   local bufstate = bufstates[bufnr]
-  if not bufstate or not bufstate.enabled then
+  if not bufstate.enabled then

comment_data.body: It could be enabled globally because we do not only expect to be enabled on buffers that exist now but also for the buffers that will be created in the future.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,13 +4,32 @@ local ms = require('vim.lsp.protocol').Methods
 local api = vim.api
 local M = {}
 
----@class (private) vim.lsp.inlay_hint.bufstate
+---@class (private) vim.lsp.inlay_hint.globalstate Global state for inlay hints
+---@field enabled boolean Whether inlay hints are enabled for this scope

comment_regular_data.body: I kept the commit history as clean as possible to make it easier to review. Thereby reducing the risk of merging this PR before the release of 0.10.

@MariaSolOs More explanations for why make `bufstates` as a `vim.defaulttable`:

1. To make `bufstate`s inherit values from the `globalstate`, we need `setmetatable` for them. Instead of defining a factory function for `bufstate`, I think creating them when indexing `bufstates` will be simpler and more effective, this approach also avoids thinking about when this factory function should be called.
2. As you can see we can avoid a lot of judgment for whether the `bufstates[bufnr]` exists.

But now I admit that this idea is not perfect. The `on_win` callback of the `nvim_set_decoration_provider` is called too trivially, if the `vim.defaulttable` takes effect here, there will be many tables in the `bufstates`. Even a temporary window like a completion candidate window of `nvim-cmp`, will have its own `bufstate` in `bufstate`. Although this won't produce a fatal error, I think it's better to avoid it. In fact, all my changes since the opening of this PR have been to optimize this problem.

Currently, to avoid this situation, I made `on_win` cannot trigger the factory function when `bufstates[bufnr]` does not exist by utilizing `rawget` instead of indexing directly inside it.
@ofseed thanks for explaining! I must confess that that level of manipulation of metatables is beyond my expertise, so I'll let others comment on the correctness of the implementation.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: feat(lsp): `vim.lsp.inlay_hint.enable()` now can take effect on all buffers.
